snippet: President Xi Jinping of China appears to have approved the new air defense zone devised to weaken Japan’s grip on disputed islands in the East China Sea.
abstract: Chinese Pres Xi Jinping appears to have approved the new air defense zone devised to weaken Japan's grip on disputed islands in the East China Sea; move is part of China's effort to expand its long-term access to the Western Pacific.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing, and Makiko Inoue and Hisako Ueno from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: President Xi Jinping of China appears to have approved the new air defense zone devised to weaken Japan’s grip on disputed islands in the East China Sea.

headline.main: Chinese Leader’s Rise Came With New Attention to Dispute With Japan
headline.print_headline: Chinese Leader’s Rise Came With New Attention to Dispute With Japan
